keyword: calories in a stick of butter
title: Calories in a Stick of Butter
meta_description: Discover calories in a stick of butter, including full nutrition breakdown per 100 g basis, totals for one stick (113 g), macros, and preparation tweaks for better choices.
h1: Calories in a Stick of Butter
assumptions: Standard US stick (1/2 cup, 113 g), unsalted butter at room temperature; values based on typical dairy butter.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, salted vs. unsalted, fat content, and exact weight. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One stick of butter (113 g) provides about 810 kcal, almost entirely from fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Switch to light butter (reduced fat, ~40% less calories per 100 g)
Use salted butter (adds ~1/4 tsp salt per stick)
Opt for grass-fed butter (similar calories, higher omega-3s)

faqs.q: How many calories in a stick of butter?
faqs.a: Approximately 810 kcal for one standard 113 g stick.

faqs.q: Is a stick of butter mostly fat?
faqs.a: Yes, about 91.5 g total fat, with 57.6 g saturated fat.
One tablespoon (14 g) has ~100 kcal; a stick is 8 tablespoons.

faqs.q: Does salted butter have more calories than unsalted?
faqs.a: No significant difference; salt adds sodium but negligible calories.

faqs.q: How does butter compare to margarine in calories?
faqs.a: Similar at ~810 kcal per stick, but margarine often has less saturated fat.
